meanings.definition: To bring under control or conquer by force
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was subducing the fierce dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent2: The police officer subducing the criminal before he could escape.
meanings.sent3: The chef was subducing the unruly pot of boiling water to prevent a disaster in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a powerful force subducing all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The storm was subducing the once raging sea into a calm, peaceful state.

meanings.definition: To reduce the intensity or strength of something
meanings.sent1: Eating a mint helped in subducing the spicy taste of the food.
meanings.sent2: The medication was effective in subducing the patient's fever.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes had a way of subducing even the grumpiest audience members.
meanings.sent4: The soft music played in the background subducing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain was subducing the heat of the scorching summer day.

meanings.sent1: She was subducing her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had a hard time subducing the excitement of the students before the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The magician was subducing the urge to reveal his tricks to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The security guard was subducing any potential disturbances at the event.
meanings.sent5: The mother was subducing her worry as she watched her child perform on stage.
